intro: Acer nigrum var. monumentale, commonly known as the black maple, is a deciduous tree native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its dark green, palmately lobed leaves that turn vibrant shades of red and orange in the fall. The tree produces small, red flowers in early spring, which are followed by winged seeds. It typically grows to a height of 20–30 meters and has a broad, spreading crown. The bark is smooth and grayish-brown, becoming fissured with age.
